title: Jupyter Notebook Tutorial - Interactive Guide
description: Learn how to use Jupyter notebooks for cybersecurity education

instructions.title: ğŸš€ Welcome to Interactive Learning!
instructions.content:
Welcome to the Cloud Threat Graph Lab Jupyter Tutorial!

This guide will teach you everything you need to know to use Jupyter notebooks for cybersecurity learning.

ğŸ¯ What You'll Learn:

ğŸ’¡ Good News: Jupyter is easier than it looks! You'll be comfortable in just a few minutes.

instructions.title: ğŸ”§ Most Important Skill: Running Code Cells
instructions.content:
The #1 skill you need: running code cells. Let's master this right now!

ğŸ“‹ Steps to Run a Cell:

  1. Click on the code cell (it gets a blue border)
  2. Press Shift + Enter (or click â–¶ï¸ play button)
  3. Wait for results (they appear below)
  4. Move to next cell (automatic or manual)

ğŸ¯ Try It Now: The cell below is your practice cell. Click on it and press Shift + Enter!

âš ï¸ Important: If nothing happens, make sure you clicked ON the gray cell (not just near it)!

instructions.title: âœ… Success Check: Did It Work?
instructions.content:
If you see a congratulations message above, you're doing great! ğŸ‰

ğŸ”§ If it didn't work:

  • Make sure you clicked ON the gray code cell
  • The cell should have a blue border when selected
  • Try pressing Shift + Enter again
  • Or click the â–¶ï¸ play button in the toolbar

ğŸ§ª Let's Try Something Interactive: The next cell shows different results each time you run it. This demonstrates how notebooks can be dynamic and interactive!

ğŸ’¡ Pro Tip: You can run the same cell multiple times to see different results!

instructions.title: ğŸ—ºï¸ Understanding the Jupyter Interface
instructions.content:
Now that you can run cells, let's understand the Jupyter Lab interface!

ğŸ” Key Areas:

  • Left Sidebar: File browser (see all notebooks)
  • Main Area: Your notebook workspace
  • Top Toolbar: Run, stop, save buttons
  • Cell Types: Text (like this) and Code (gray background)

ğŸ“± Essential Buttons:

  • â–¶ï¸ Run: Execute the selected cell
  • â¹ï¸ Stop: Stop running code
  • ğŸ’¾ Save: Save your progress
  • â• Add: Insert new cells
ğŸ¯ Navigation Tip: Use the left sidebar to switch between different learning notebooks!

instructions.title: ğŸ“– The Golden Rule: Top to Bottom
instructions.content:
ğŸ¥‡ Golden Rule: Always run notebook cells from top to bottom!

ğŸ¤” Why Order Matters:

  • Later cells depend on earlier cells
  • Variables are defined in previous cells
  • Libraries are imported at the top
  • Skipping around causes errors

ğŸ“š Think of it like reading a book:

  1. Read the explanation (text cells)
  2. Run the code (code cells)
  3. See the results (output)
  4. Move to the next concept
âœ… Best Practice: When in doubt, restart from the top and run all cells in order!

instructions.title: ğŸ§ª Practice Time: Security Example
instructions.content:
Let's practice with a mini cybersecurity example! This simulates the kind of learning you'll do in the real notebooks.

ğŸ¯ Learning Goals:

  • Practice running cells in order
  • See how cells build on each other
  • Experience security-focused content
  • Understand the complete workflow

ğŸ“‹ Instructions:

  1. Run the "Setup" cell first
  2. Then run the "Analysis" cell
  3. Notice how the second cell uses data from the first
ğŸ® Real Learning Preview: This is exactly how the security notebooks work!

instructions.title: ğŸ“Š Continue the Security Analysis
instructions.content:
Now run the analysis cell to see how notebooks build on previous results!

ğŸ” What You Should Notice:

  • This cell uses data from the previous cell
  • It shows user information and attack paths
  • Results are formatted nicely for learning
  • This is exactly how real security analysis works

ğŸ’¡ Key Insight: If you tried to run this cell BEFORE the setup cell, you'd get an error because security_data wouldn't be defined!

ğŸ”§ Troubleshooting: If you get an error, go back and run the setup cell first!

instructions.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Essential Troubleshooting Skills
instructions.content:
Every Jupyter user needs to know these troubleshooting techniques!

ğŸš¨ Common Problems & Solutions:

ProblemSolution
"Code won't run"Click on cell first, then Shift+Enter
"Variable not defined"Run cells from top to bottom
"Notebook seems frozen"Kernel â†’ Restart Kernel
"Lost track of where I am"Use left sidebar Table of Contents

ğŸ”„ Nuclear Option: When all else fails, go to Kernel menu â†’ Restart and Run All Cells

ğŸ’¡ Remember: These problems happen to everyone! Don't worry - just restart and try again.
